title.narrative: EDUCATION IN EMERGENCIES

description.narrative: National and sub-national education authorities have increased capacity to mitigate, prepare for and respond to emergencies, and emergency services are delivered, in line with the CCCs., which contributes to Access To Quality Learning Opportunities. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: EDUCATION outcome: Girls and boys of school age especially vulnerable children in deprived provinces and areas, access primary education that is progressively child friendly and demonstrates improved learning outcomes.

participating-org.narrative: DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION GHOR GHOR PROVINCE

sector.narrative: Provision of (formal and non-formal) multiple-levels or alternative pathways of education (including in temporary learning spaces)
Technical assistance - Equitable access to quality education

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: National and sub-national education authorities have increased capacity to mitigate, prepare for and respond to emergencies, andemergency services are delivered, in line with the CCCs.

description.narrative: Despite the challenges faced during the year, 199,184 out-of-school children (OOSC) (of 238,123– including 108,738 girls) – accessed quality education in 6,456 newly established community-based education (CBE) classes in 15 provinces. In total, 110,115 children received learning materials, 3,657 teachers were trained on active learning and classroom management and 2,362 CBE classes were provided with handwashing stations and soap for proper hygiene practices and as a part of the COVID-19 response. Furthermore, support to previously enrolled children continued for a second year in Sar-e-Pul, Paktika and Faryab. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:12/01/2022
